Direct Coombs test helps to identify the presence of antibodies on the surface of red blood cells, which can indicate autoimmune hemolytic anemia. Osmotic fragility test may be used to diagnose hereditary spherocytosis, while ADAMTS13 activity and inhibitor profile and flow cytometry are used to diagnose thrombotic thrombocytopenic purpura (TTP) and paroxysmal nocturnal hemoglobinuria (PNH), respectively, which do not fit the clinical picture in this case.
